metadata.title: Easy Rasam Recipe- South Indian Recipe
metadata.description:
Tomato Rasam- South Indian recipe- Made with the tomatoes freshly picked from my garden. This is a spicy and tangy curry- served as a side dish with rice in South India. 
Recipe (with some tweaks) on my blog: http://www.thasneen.com/cooking/easy-rasam-recipe/

FOLLOW ME HERE:

Website: http://www.thasneen.com/cooking/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CookingwithThas/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cookingwiththas/

transcription: [00:00.000] Prep time 5 mins, Cook time 15 mins, Total time 20 mins
[00:05.000] Author: Thasneen, Recipe type: Side dish, Cuisine: Indian, Serves: 4 People

[00:10.000] Ingredients to grind: Small onions 3, Garlic 2 cloves, Ginger 1 inch slice, Green chilies 1 or 2, Whole black peppercorns ½ tsp, Cumin seeds ½ tsp, Tomato 1 chopped, Cilantro 1 handful, Water ¼ cup
[00:20.000] Other Ingredients: Fresh tamarind 2 inch slice soaked in 4 tbsp lukewarm water, Oil 1½ tbsp, Mustard seeds 1 tsp, Whole dry red chili 1, Curry leaves 1 sprig, Salt to taste
[00:30.000] Soak tamarind in lukewarm water for 5 minutes, squeeze and strain the juice
[00:40.000] In a blender, combine all 'to grind' ingredients to a coarsely smooth paste. Keep aside
[00:50.000] Place a saucepan over medium heat, add oil and heat
[00:55.000] Add mustard seeds and let them splutter
[01:00.000] Add dry red chili and curry leaves, sauté for a few seconds
[01:05.000] Add the ground paste and combine well
[01:10.000] Rinse blender with ¾ cup water and pour into saucepan
[01:15.000] Add tamarind juice and salt to taste, combine well
[01:20.000] Cook for a few minutes until raw smell goes away
[01:30.000] Let the rasam come to a boil
[01:40.000] Taste and adjust salt or pepper for more spice if needed
[01:50.000] Remove from heat and keep covered for some time
[02:00.000] Serve rasam along with rice, fish curry, or vegetable curries
[02:10.000] Enjoy your tangy and spicy Easy Rasam!
